data.title: Faculty & Staff
data.text:
Joined City Academy: 2000

Education: B.S., Kaplan University

M.S., Kaplan University

“My passion for education stems from my desire to see every student reach their full potential. It is so rewarding and humbling to know that as educators, we serve a purpose that is much more vast than ourselves. I’m a firm believer in relationship building. When we encourage, inspire, and build a strong rapport with our scholars, that is the moment when they begin to trust us and know that we care about them. Moreover, I believe all students can learn when they are immersed in an environment that is conducive to learning, and where they feel safe, valued, and heard. When I walk through the doors of City Academy, I will continue to walk in my purpose and serve our scholars every day.

One of my favorite quotes is by Dr. Rita Pierson who states: “Every child deserves a champion: an adult that will not give up on them, who understands the power of connections and insists they become the best that they can possibly be.”

Here at City Academy, we are grateful that our scholars are surrounded by Champions who are here to help them thrive.”

Before going into administration, Donna was our former Junior Kindergarten teacher for 19 years. She also had the opportunity to teach at the 1st and 5th grade levels. During the 2020-2021 school year, she took on the role as the Director of Early Childhood. As we enter the 2023-2024 school year, Ms. Hynes will move into her new role as our Dean of Students and Families. She is excited to take on this role and looks forward to working with students, families, and faculty to continue building partnerships, classroom community, strengthening our home/school connection, and embodying our school’s mission. During the 2014-2015 school year, Ms. Hynes began City Academy’s first family literacy night.

Ms. Hynes is a member of the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC), the International Literacy Association, and The St. Louis Women Leaders Association. She also currently serves on the Business Development Committee at Cornerstone Center for Early Learning.

In her spare time, she enjoys spending time with her family, reading, traveling, and shopping.

Joined City Academy: 2014, 2024

Education: B.S. in Elementary Education, University of Missouri – St. Louis

M. Ed., University of Missouri – St. Louis

Ed. S. Candidate, University of Missouri – St. Louis

Formerly known as Ms. Duran, Trish first came to City Academy in 2014 as a Student Teacher and was the 2nd-4th grade Math Teacher the following year. She married her husband and moved to Texas, where she continued her love of teaching math.

Wanting to further grow as an educator, Trish started graduate school after moving back to St. Louis with her family. She has an M. Ed. in Educational Psychology and is currently completing her Ed. S. in School Psychology. She is eager to apply all she is learning to support the incredible teachers and students at City Academy.

In her free time, Trish and her husband, Michael, can usually be found running around with their two energetic kids, Emmy and Jack.

Joined City Academy: 2002

Education: B.A., Southern Illinois University-Edwardsville

M.S., Fontbonne University

Shalawn Fennoy started her career at City Academy as the first 4th grade Teacher. Wanting to grow in her profession, she has since had the opportunity to serve students across grade levels including 2nd, 4th, and 6th, and currently serves as the 5th Grade Humanities Teacher. Through such experiences, Shalawn has gained a greater understanding of the significant impact each grade has had on another as well as exploring the developmental differences among children.

In her role as the 5th Grade Teacher, Shalawn conveys that the most integral piece to teaching 5th grade is her chance to witness students believe a positive future self is possible and relevant. Students begin to embrace the value of individuality; with a better understanding of purpose, persistence, and potential. “Teaching is so much more than pouring content into a child, it is inspiring growth and change, and empowering students to be GREAT.”

An active advocate for education in St. Louis, Shalawn has participated in numerous community service organizations and in 2012 she was nominated for the Teacher of Distinction Award.

Outside of her duties as a teacher, Shalawn enjoys spending time with family, enjoying live jazz bands and immersing herself in a good suspense novel, filled with plot twists and thrillers.

Joined City Academy: 2023

Education: Purdue University

Considered a “boomerang”, Ada has found her way back to her purpose and passion as an educator. She has over 23 years in the field of education. Ada has been teaching since she was a child with her dolls as the students. Following the dreams of others, she graduated from Purdue University with a degree in Computer Science and Hospitality Management. After years in the corporate world, she followed her dream and began teaching in the Independent Schools of St. Louis while raising her twin daughters. Ada boomeranged back into the corporate world as a Senior Consultant / Analyst for five years and now has returned back home to St. Louis and City Academy.

Joined City Academy: 2015

Education: B.S., Harris Stowe State University

Evelyn comes from a family of educators and knew at a young age she wanted to follow in their footsteps. In 2014 she was thrilled to be placed at City Academy for student teaching and immediately knew this was the school community she wanted to be part of long-term. After graduation, Evelyn officially began her career here as a substitute teacher and shortly thereafter signed on as the K-2nd STEAM teacher. Since then she has moved to Junior Kindergarten where she continues to teach STEAM to our youngest scholars.

Outside of school, Evelyn enjoys spending time with her husband and young daughter, reading, experimenting with photography, and traveling.

Joined City Academy: 2019

Education: B.A. Early Childhood Education & B.A. Psychology., Webster University

M.A. Special Education, Webster University

Alison came to City Academy to launch the first 3- and 4-year-old classroom in the newly expanded Early Childhood Center. Prior to joining the City Academy team, Alison taught 3- and 4-year-olds at Ladue Early Childhood Center for four years, and ages three-five at Minier Early Childhood Center for five years. She also previously coached high school girls’ varsity lacrosse for eight years and received the Coach of the Year award in 2011.

Alison is a St. Louis local and a graduate of Mary Institute and St. Louis Country Day School, where she attended from junior kindergarten through 12th grade. In her free time, Alison enjoys hiking and spending time with her friends and family.

Joined City Academy: 2008, 2022

Education: A.B., College of the Holy Cross

A.B., College of the Holy Cross

M.Ed., Crosscultural Instruction, National University

M.Ed., Gifted Education, Lindenwood University

Ph.D. Candidate, Saint Louis University

Born and raised in Chicago, Kip is the product of Jesuit schooling. He attended Saint Ignatius College Prep, College of the Holy Cross, and he is currently a Ph.D. Candidate at Saint Louis University.

Moving to St. Louis in 2008, Kip began his first “tour of duty” at City Academy, teaching 5th and 6th grades. In 2015, Kip left to become the Director of Gifted and Talented for St. Louis Public Schools. Returning to CA in 2022, Kip resumes his role as 6th Grade Humanities Teacher where he shares his two great passions, reading great literature and economics, with his students.

Kip and his wife Rodnee are the proud parents of Zachary and Rylie, both City Academy alumni.

Joined City Academy: 2023

Education:B.F.A., Mixed Media and Studio Art, Minor in Strategic Communications, University of Kansas

M.P.S. Candidate, Business of Art and Design, Maryland Institute College of Art

Zac is a proud alumnus of City Academy, graduating in 2011. He continued his education at Saint Louis Priory School, graduating in 2017. During his time in undergrad, Zac participated in several academic and non-academic art shows, highlighting his dedication to the arts. After moving back to Saint Louis in 2023, Zac spent a year as the communications intern at City Academy. Now, he blends his passion for art and love for City Academy as the Art teacher, bringing his creative spirit and dedication to inspire young artists. Zac is particularly passionate about using art as a bridge to connect students to the greater world, fostering a holistic learning experience. He takes immense pride in being part of the City Academy community once again.

Outside the classroom, Zac loves spending time outdoors, listening to Afrobeats, and working on launching his Afrocentric clothing brand focused on closed-loop sustainability. Zac is also a recent newlywed, proud to share his life with his wife, Jasmine.

Joined City Academy: 2019

Michelle joined City Academy as an Extended Day Teacher, later becoming a Classroom Monitor. Now in the 3- and 4-year old classroom, she loves assisting with daily duties. She as also returned to her role as an Extended Day Teacher. Michelle has always had a heart for children, and she finds much joy in watching them grow. Michelle’s first job was babysitting, and then she moved on to the corporate world. After that she ran a non-profit group giving out school supplies, and later was a stay-at-home mom. During her daughter’s last year of high school, she was given an opportunity to work with children at City Academy, and Michelle jumped at the opportunity.

Joined City Academy: 2022

Education: B. Ed., University of Missouri-Columbia

M.Ed., University of Missouri-St. Louis

Laurianne has thoroughly enjoyed spending her career teaching 2nd grade reading and library and celebrating the love of great books with her students. She grew up in Cool Valley playing school with her very first “student,” her little sister, who learned to read as they played! She was born in Columbus, Ohio and cheers on the Ohio State Buckeyes every college football season, one of her most favorite times of the year. She is an animal lover and enjoys reading historical fiction, mysteries, and nonfiction. She smiles every time she passes the “Cool Valley” sign on the way to City Academy each day, remembering playing school all those years ago. She couldn’t imagine doing anything else as a grown-up today!
